node.title: Melbourne Cup-winning owner fined for COVID-19 breach during Flemington celebrations
node.alt: A race horse owner holds the 2021 Melbourne Cup with his right hand.
node.description: One of Verry Elleegant's owners is fined $10,000 after jumping a fence while celebrating Tuesday's victory at Flemington Racecourse.
node.content:
["An owner of Melbourne Cup winner Verry Elleegant has been fined $10,000 for breaching Flemington Racecourse's COVID-19 protocols after\u00a0jumping a fence while celebrating\u00a0Tuesday's victory.", "Prominent Melbourne businessman Brae Sokolski hopped the mounting yard fence to meet Verry Elleegant and jockey James McDonald after their comfortable win in the $8 million race.", "Under Racing Victoria (RV) and Victoria Racing Club COVID-19\u00a0protocols, the area is strictly reserved for jockeys, trainers, media and other race-day officials.", "Mr Sokolski was also not\u00a0wearing a face mask, which is required under mounting yard rules.", "He was interviewed by RV stewards on Thursday and pleaded guilty, reducing the severity of his sentence.", "\"Stewards heard submissions on penalty from Mr Sokolski and, after doing so, took into consideration his guilty plea, his candid evidence, his unblemished record over a long period of time and that he expressed remorse,\" RV said in a statement.", "\"The stewards also took into consideration the nature of the offending, the potential ramifications that could flow from a breach of Racing Victoria's COVID-19 protocols, and that the penalty must be sufficient enough to deter others from breaching those protocols.", "\"Taking into account the above considerations, the stewards determined that Mr Sokolski be issued a fine of $10,000.\"", "Mr Sokolski said it was an \"impetuous decision\" to jump the fence and the emotion of the moment \"got the better\" of him.", "\"It certainly wasn't premeditated and I am very apologetic,\" he told SEN radio before speaking to stewards.", "\"There is no excuse for that and those protocols are in place for good reason.\"", "", "
Verry Elleegant, right,\u00a0beat home Incentivise to win the Melbourne Cup.(Getty Images: Vince Caligiuri)
", "Mr Sokolski part-owns Verry Elleegant and runner-up Incentivise with Ozzie and Victor Kheir, and John O'Neill.", "Verry Elleegant \u2014 a 10-time Group One winner \u2014 has been a mainstay of Mr Sokolski's thoroughbred team since she arrived\u00a0from New Zealand in 2018.", "The mare transferred to Sydney trainer Chris Waller's stable after Darren Weir was disqualified in early 2019.", "AAP/ABC"]
